entry.title: 514: Designing a Villain
entry.summary: Elon launches another AI company, leaks suggest Apple might enable sideloading, and why we should let Chaos-GPT run free.

entry.title: 506: Three Wild and Crazy Topics
entry.summary: We surprise each other with three secret topics, with one big catch.

entry.title: Linux Action News 288
entry.summary: A classic gadget gets a Linux-powered new lease on life, the next project getting Rusty, great news for Btrfs users, and more.

entry.title: 513: Apple's Golden Hour
entry.summary: Forces beyond Apple's control just reined in their rise, and we ponder the coming sunset. Plus, the tool we found uses ChatGPT to help you debug errors.

entry.title: 505: Keep Your Darn Secrets
entry.summary: We try out the most secure messaging app in the world, and Wes’ new note system that's so great you’ll want to abandon your current one.

entry.title: Linux Action News 287
entry.summary: A fresh take on open-source funding, Fedora’s plan for better encryption out of the box, and our impressions of the latest Ubuntu Beta.

entry.title: 512: The Hysterics Chronicles
entry.summary: Our thoughts on the recent AI hysteria and why it betrays the massive egos involved, our issues with the RESTRICT Act, and we do some Monday morning code review.

entry.title: 504: It's a Trap!
entry.summary: Why using the iPhone makes it harder to run Linux; Chris follows up on his four-month-long challenge to ditch iOS for GrapheneOS. Plus, Brent's extended stay in Berlin has led to some developments you won't want to miss.

entry.title: Linux Action News 286
entry.summary: What we're liking about GNOME 44, how Microsoft's Linux distro is trying to attract more users, and we bust a CentOS myth.

entry.title: 511: Robot Chat Shack
entry.summary: Mike's spent 90+ days with GitHub Co-Pilot, and shares the surprising conclusion.

entry.title: 503: Berlin with Brent
entry.summary: Brent dives deep into Nextcloud's new release from inside their offices, and takes an unexpected dip in the local lake with a listener.

entry.title: Linux Action News 285
entry.summary: Nextcloud moves to the front of the pack with their new release, a moment to appreciate curl, and Amazon goes all in with Fedora. Special Guest: Brent Gervais.

entry.title: 510: Edge of Disaster
entry.summary: Microsoft's moonshot is turning into a crapshoot.
